main event: On 17th August 1959 at Donaldson AFB in South Carolina, a bright red fireball was observed for about 3 seconds before exploding and fading out. After the explosion, the object moved toward the ground.
interesting points: The observation was made by the AFB personnel, lending credibility to the sighting.
The object was described as a ball of bright red fire with a slight trail of fire prior to the explosion.
The report mentions insufficient data for evaluation and lists possible conclusions as balloon, natural, or unknown.
Tower personnel at Donaldson AFB and MPS (Military Police Service) found the object unusual, suggesting it was much brighter than a typical meteorite.
The altitude of the object was estimated at 20,000 ft, but the distance could not be estimated.
